qas.question: When did the strife between Austria and Prussia erupt?
in What conflict of the German war did the Prussians successfully create the North German Confederation?
What was Germany going to be called if Prussian won?
What was Austria not willing to give up to settle the conflict?

answers.text: non-German-speaking land inside of the Austrian Empire

qas.question: When did Austria and Prussia go to war?
Who won the battle of Koniggratz?
What did the Prussians want Germany to unify under?
What was created when the Prussians defeated Austria??
Who did Austria go to war with in the late 18th century?
Who did the Austrians defeat at the Battle of Koniggratz?
What land was Prussia unwilling to give up?
Who did Austria want ti unify as little Germany?

context: In <a0_0><a4_0>1866<a4_0/><a0_0/>, the feud between Austria and <b8_0>Prussia<b8_0/> finally came to a head. There were several reasons behind this war. As German nationalism grew strongly inside the German Confederation and neither could decide on how Germany was going to be unified into a nation-state. The Austrians favoured the Greater Germany unification but were not willing to give up any of the <a3_0><b10_0>non-German-speaking<b10_0/> land inside of the Austrian Empire<a3_0/> and take second place to Prussia. The Prussians however wanted to unify <b11_0>Germany<b11_0/> as <a2_0><a6_0>Little Germany<a6_0/><a2_0/> primarily by the Kingdom of Prussia, whilst excluding Austria. In the final battle of the German war <a1_0>(Battle of Königgrätz<a1_0/>) the <a5_0><b9_0>Prussia<a5_0/>ns<b9_0/> successfully defeated the Austrians and succeeded in creating the <a7_0>North German Confederation<a7_0/>.
